meanings.definition: A person or group that establishes or initiates something.
meanings.sent1: The instituters of the club organized the first meeting.
meanings.sent2: The instituters of the project worked hard to get it off the ground.
meanings.sent3: The instituters of the bake sale accidentally used salt instead of sugar!
meanings.sent4: Their team was like instituters of change, revolutionizing the industry.
meanings.sent5: The instituters of the movement inspired others to join their cause.

meanings.definition: The act of introducing or setting up something.
meanings.sent1: The instituters of the new policy faced some challenges.
meanings.sent2: The instituters of the event made sure everything was ready on time.
meanings.sent3: The instituters of the game forgot to bring the main prize!
meanings.sent4: Her speech was like the instituters of a new era in politics.
meanings.sent5: The instituters of the tradition passed down their knowledge to the next generation.
